title: Messages with less 4096 chars are dropped from chats
body:
# Bug Report

## Problem
Currently message limit for dropping messages from chats are somewhere between 3600 and 3994 char instead of expected 4096 according to https://github.com/status-im/status-go/blob/3d5e21e27689e0ff126e69db30ac6352f3dd45dc/protocol/message_validator.go#L13
Can reproduce in 1-1 and public chat

#### Expected behavior
can see messages in chat

#### Actual behavior
message with 3600 chars is sent and received, message with 3994 was sent but dropped (or never received)


### Reproduction

[comment]: # (Describe how we can replicate the bug step by step.)

- Open Status
- Join any public channel
- Send message > 3994 char

### Additional Information

- Status version: RC 1.7
- Operating System: Android, iOS

#### Logs
Message was sent at 14:18 

Sender: [Status-debug-logs.zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/files/5276793/Status-debug-logs.zip)
Receiver: [status_logs.zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/files/5276795/status_logs.zip)

Confirmed that for some reason is being marked as too long 
```
t=2020-09-24T14:18:40+0000 lvl=warn msg="failed to validate message" site=handleChatMessage error="text shouldn't be longer than 4096"
t=2020-09-24T14:18:40+0000 lvl=warn msg="failed to handle ChatMessage" site=RetrieveAll error="text shouldn't be longer than 4096"
```

The issue is unicode characters, as we are counting byte length and not characters length here
https://github.com/status-im/status-go/blob/3d5e21e27689e0ff126e69db30ac6352f3dd45dc/protocol/message_validator.go#L13

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12668681/how-to-get-the-number-of-characters-in-a-string

Yes, you are right abot chinese/japanese language. Limit is less in that case.
1310 still can be sent and received, 2620 - no.
